segment.source: Planning for High Availability with App-V 5.1
segment.target: Planning for High Availability with App-V 5.1

segment.source: Planning for High Availability with App-V 5.1
segment.target: Planning for High Availability with App-V 5.1

segment.source: Planning for High Availability with App-V 5.1
segment.target: Planning for High Availability with App-V 5.1

segment.source: Microsoft Application Virtualization (App-V) 5.1 system configurations can take advantage of options that maintain a high level of available service.
segment.target: Microsoft Application Virtualization (App-V) 5.1 system configurations can take advantage of options that maintain a high level of available service.

segment.source: Use the information in the following sections to help you understand the options to deploy App-V 5.1 in a highly available configuration.
segment.target: Use the information in the following sections to help you understand the options to deploy App-V 5.1 in a highly available configuration.

segment.source: Support for Microsoft SQL Server clustering
segment.target: Support for Microsoft SQL Server clustering

segment.source: Support for IIS Network Load Balancing
segment.target: Support for IIS Network Load Balancing

segment.source: Support for clustered file servers when running (SCS) mode
segment.target: Support for clustered file servers when running (SCS) mode

segment.source: Support for Microsoft SQL Server Mirroring
segment.target: Support for Microsoft SQL Server Mirroring

segment.source: Support for Microsoft SQL Server Always On
segment.target: Support for Microsoft SQL Server Always On

segment.source: Support for Microsoft SQL Server clustering
segment.target: Support for Microsoft SQL Server clustering

segment.source: You can run the App-V Management database and Reporting database on computers that are running Microsoft SQL Server clusters.
segment.target: You can run the App-V Management database and Reporting database on computers that are running Microsoft SQL Server clusters.

segment.source: However, you must install the databases using scripts.
segment.target: However, you must install the databases using scripts.

segment.source: For instructions, see How to Deploy the App-V Databases by Using SQL Scripts.
segment.target: For instructions, see How to Deploy the App-V Databases by Using SQL Scripts.

segment.source: Support for IIS Network Load Balancing
segment.target: Support for IIS Network Load Balancing

segment.source: You can use Internet Information Services (IIS) Network Load Balancing to configure a highly available environment for computers running the App-V 5.x Management, Publishing, and Reporting services which are deployed through IIS.
segment.target: You can use Internet Information Services (IIS) Network Load Balancing to configure a highly available environment for computers running the App-V 5.x Management, Publishing, and Reporting services which are deployed through IIS.

segment.source: Review the following for more information about configuring IIS and Network Load Balancing for computers running Windows Server operating systems:
segment.target: Review the following for more information about configuring IIS and Network Load Balancing for computers running Windows Server operating systems:

segment.source: Provides information about configuring Internet Information Services (IIS) 7.0.
segment.target: Provides information about configuring Internet Information Services (IIS) 7.0.

segment.source: Achieving High Availability and Scalability - ARR and NLB (http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=316369)
segment.target: Achieving High Availability and Scalability - ARR and NLB (http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=316369)

segment.source: Configuring Microsoft Windows Server
segment.target: Configuring Microsoft Windows Server

segment.source: Network Load Balancing (http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=316370).
segment.target: Network Load Balancing (http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=316370).

segment.source: This information also applies to IIS Network Load Balancing (NLB) clusters in Windows Server 2008, Windows Server 2008 R2, or Windows Server 2012.
segment.target: This information also applies to IIS Network Load Balancing (NLB) clusters in Windows Server 2008, Windows Server 2008 R2, or Windows Server 2012.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: The IIS Network Load Balancing functionality in Windows Server 2012 is generally the same as in Windows Server 2008 R2.
segment.target: The IIS Network Load Balancing functionality in Windows Server 2012 is generally the same as in Windows Server 2008 R2.

segment.source: However, some task details are changed in Windows Server 2012.
segment.target: However, some task details are changed in Windows Server 2012.

segment.source: For information on new ways to do tasks, see Common Management Tasks and Navigation in Windows Server 2012 R2 Preview and Windows Server 2012 (http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=316371).
segment.target: For information on new ways to do tasks, see Common Management Tasks and Navigation in Windows Server 2012 R2 Preview and Windows Server 2012 (http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=316371).

segment.source: Support for clustered file servers when running (SCS) mode
segment.target: Support for clustered file servers when running (SCS) mode

segment.source: Running App-V 5.1 in Share Content Store (SCS) mode with clustered file servers is supported.
segment.target: Running App-V 5.1 in Share Content Store (SCS) mode with clustered file servers is supported.

segment.source: The following steps can be used to enable this configuration:
segment.target: The following steps can be used to enable this configuration:

segment.source: Configure App-V 5.1 to run in client SCS mode.
segment.target: Configure App-V 5.1 to run in client SCS mode.

segment.source: For more information about configuring App-V 5.1 SCS mode, see How to Install the App-V 5.1 Client for Shared Content Store Mode.
segment.target: For more information about configuring App-V 5.1 SCS mode, see How to Install the App-V 5.1 Client for Shared Content Store Mode.

segment.source: Configure the file server cluster configured in both the Microsoft Server 2012 scale out mode and pre 2012 mode with a virtual SAN.
segment.target: Configure the file server cluster configured in both the Microsoft Server 2012 scale out mode and pre 2012 mode with a virtual SAN.

segment.source: The following steps can be used to validate the configuration:
segment.target: The following steps can be used to validate the configuration:

segment.source: Add a package on the publishing server.
segment.target: Add a package on the publishing server.

segment.source: For more information about adding a package, see How to Add or Upgrade Packages by Using the Management Console.
segment.target: For more information about adding a package, see How to Add or Upgrade Packages by Using the Management Console.

segment.source: Perform a publishing refresh on the computer running the App-V 5.1 client and open an application.
segment.target: Perform a publishing refresh on the computer running the App-V 5.1 client and open an application.

segment.source: Switch cluster nodes mid-publishing refresh and mid-streaming to ensure fail-over works correctly.
segment.target: Switch cluster nodes mid-publishing refresh and mid-streaming to ensure fail-over works correctly.

segment.source: Review the following for more information about configuring Windows Server Failover clusters:
segment.target: Review the following for more information about configuring Windows Server Failover clusters:

segment.source: Checklist: Create a Clustered File Server (http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=316372).
segment.target: Checklist: Create a Clustered File Server (http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=316372).

segment.source: Use Cluster Shared Volumes in a Windows Server 2012 Failover Cluster (http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=316373).
segment.target: Use Cluster Shared Volumes in a Windows Server 2012 Failover Cluster (http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=316373).

segment.source: Support for Microsoft SQL Server Mirroring
segment.target: Support for Microsoft SQL Server Mirroring

segment.source: Using Microsoft SQL Server mirroring, where the App-V 5.1 management server database is mirrored utilizing two SQL Server instances, for App-V 5.1 management server databases is supported.
segment.target: Using Microsoft SQL Server mirroring, where the App-V 5.1 management server database is mirrored utilizing two SQL Server instances, for App-V 5.1 management server databases is supported.

segment.source: Review the following for more information about configuring Microsoft SQL Server Mirroring:
segment.target: Review the following for more information about configuring Microsoft SQL Server Mirroring:

segment.source: How to: Prepare a Mirror Database for Mirroring (Transact-SQL) (http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=316375)
segment.target: How to: Prepare a Mirror Database for Mirroring (Transact-SQL) (http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=316375)

segment.source: Establish a Database Mirroring Session Using Windows Authentication (SQL Server Management Studio) (http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=316377)
segment.target: Establish a Database Mirroring Session Using Windows Authentication (SQL Server Management Studio) (http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=316377)

segment.source: The following steps can be used to validate the configuration:
segment.target: The following steps can be used to validate the configuration:

segment.source: Initiate a Microsoft SQL Server Mirroring session.
segment.target: Initiate a Microsoft SQL Server Mirroring session.

segment.source: Select Failover to designate a new master Microsoft SQL Server instance.
segment.target: Select Failover to designate a new master Microsoft SQL Server instance.

segment.source: Verify that the App-V 5.1 management server continues to function as expected after the failover.
segment.target: Verify that the App-V 5.1 management server continues to function as expected after the failover.

segment.source: The connection string on the management server can be modified to include failover partner = server2.
segment.target: The connection string on the management server can be modified to include failover partner = server2.

segment.source: This will only help when the primary on the mirror has failed over to the secondary and the computer running the App-V 5.1 client is doing a fresh connection (say after reboot).
segment.target: This will only help when the primary on the mirror has failed over to the secondary and the computer running the App-V 5.1 client is doing a fresh connection (say after reboot).

segment.source: Use the following steps to modify the connection string to include failover partner = server2:
segment.target: Use the following steps to modify the connection string to include failover partner = server2:

segment.source: Important
segment.target: Important

segment.source: This topic describes how to change the Windows registry by using Registry Editor.
segment.target: This topic describes how to change the Windows registry by using Registry Editor.

segment.source: If you change the Windows registry incorrectly, you can cause serious problems that might require you to reinstall Windows.
segment.target: If you change the Windows registry incorrectly, you can cause serious problems that might require you to reinstall Windows.

segment.source: You should make a backup copy of the registry files (System.dat and User.dat) before you change the registry.
segment.target: You should make a backup copy of the registry files (System.dat and User.dat) before you change the registry.

segment.source: Microsoft cannot guarantee that the problems that might occur when you change the registry can be resolved.
segment.target: Microsoft cannot guarantee that the problems that might occur when you change the registry can be resolved.

segment.source: Change the registry at your own risk.
segment.target: Change the registry at your own risk.

segment.source: Login to the management server and open regedit.
segment.target: Login to the management server and open regedit.

segment.source: Navigate to HKEYLOCALMACHINESoftwareMicrosoftAppVServerManagementService.
segment.target: Navigate to HKEYLOCALMACHINESoftwareMicrosoftAppVServerManagementService.

segment.source: Modify the MANAGEMENTSQLCONNECTIONSTRING value with the failover partner = server2.
segment.target: Modify the MANAGEMENTSQLCONNECTIONSTRING value with the failover partner = server2.

segment.source: Restart management service using the IIS console.
segment.target: Restart management service using the IIS console.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: Database Mirroring is on the list of Deprecated Database Engine Features for Microsoft SQL Server 2012 due to the AlwaysOn feature available with Microsoft SQL Server 2012.
segment.target: Database Mirroring is on the list of Deprecated Database Engine Features for Microsoft SQL Server 2012 due to the AlwaysOn feature available with Microsoft SQL Server 2012.

segment.source: Click any of the following links for more information:
segment.target: Click any of the following links for more information:

segment.source: How to: Prepare a Mirror Database for Mirroring (Transact-SQL) (http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=394235).
segment.target: How to: Prepare a Mirror Database for Mirroring (Transact-SQL) (http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=394235).

segment.source: How to: Configure a Database Mirroring Session (SQL Server Management Studio) (http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=394236).
segment.target: How to: Configure a Database Mirroring Session (SQL Server Management Studio) (http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=394236).

segment.source: Establish a Database Mirroring Session Using Windows Authentication (SQL Server Management Studio) (http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=394237).
segment.target: Establish a Database Mirroring Session Using Windows Authentication (SQL Server Management Studio) (http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=394237).

segment.source: Deprecated Database Engine Features in SQL Server 2012 (http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=394238).
segment.target: Deprecated Database Engine Features in SQL Server 2012 (http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=394238).

segment.source: Support for Microsoft SQL Server Always On configuration
segment.target: Support for Microsoft SQL Server Always On configuration

segment.source: The App-V 5.1 management server database supports deployments to computers running Microsoft SQL Server with the Always On configuration.
segment.target: The App-V 5.1 management server database supports deployments to computers running Microsoft SQL Server with the Always On configuration.

segment.target: Got a suggestion for App-V?

segment.target: Add or vote on suggestions here.
